ThingDef.label: 7,5cm PaK 40 Panzergrau Paint
ThingDef.description: The 7,5cm Panzerabwehrkanone 40 was a German anti-tank gun developed in 1939-1941 by Rheinmetall and used during the Second World War. With 23 303 examples produced, the Pak 40 formed the backbone of German anti-tank guns for the later part of World War II, mostly in towed form, but also on a number of tank destroyers such as the Marder series.
